stanza.line: Those lines that I before have writ do lielie
Even those that said I could not love you dearerdearer
Yet then my judgment knew no reason whywhy
My most full flame should afterwards burn clearerclearer
But reckoning time whose millioned accidentsaccidents
Creep in twixt vows and change decrees of kingskings
Tan sacred beauty blunt the sharp intentsintents
Divert strong minds to the course of altring thingsthings
Alas why fearing of time tyrannytyranny
Might I not then say Now I love you bestbest
When I was certain oer incertaintyincertainty
Crowning the present doubting of the restrest
Love is a babe then might I not say soso
To give full growth to that which still doth growgrow
